channel.title: jimgrisham tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from jimgrisham.

item.description: @or_fade @TaintedSaint2 @SageMD1908 @CactusBerg @sarahnferris 12-packs of Coca-Cola at grocery stores seem to be around $6 to $8 when not on sale. At a Walmart in the South last night, they were just under $6.

@jprupp @FreightAlley @EricRego8 The refinery issues are apparently diesel-specific (especially re: low-sulfur diesel) and have been building for several years (i.e. pre-pandemic), but to the extent that any kerosene-based fuels are transported by diesel-powered trucks or trains, yes.
@klausenhauser @ChefMiew @sdbaral Elevators are known for their amazing cellular & WiFi reception, after all.

@slamastack The only safe tech for this sort of thing is legacy, open-standard tech such as #X10 or #Insteon and the modern (but much more complicated) #Zigbee or proprietary (#Zwave) equivalents. Worst-case, a hub might have to be replaced. My X-10 switches from the mid-90s still work!

@DrKateJMiller @NatMorson My ADHD brain would probably have done great as a farmer in a pre-industrial worldâ€¦ and likewise thrived in the strict structure of the military (as long as I was on duty). In the world in which we live, though, it needs medication (until better treatments are discovered).

@LisaEsther6 @DrKateJMiller When itâ€™s not caught until adulthood, there is a whole smorgasbord of learned coping mechanisms and maladaptive behaviors that need to be unraveled. That process isnâ€™t quick or easy. ðŸ˜ž

@DrKateJMiller @CanadianKayMD Iâ€™ve heard that until a decade or so ago, the common belief was that it was something kids outgrew by adulthood, so diagnosis was rarely sought or offered. Itâ€™s probably _vastly_ undiagnosed in people currently over age 30, and even more so for people over age 50.

@PenfoldDavid @TwitterSafety @wongmjane Weâ€™ve been continuously working to combat spammy & duplicative content on Twitter at scale and our new Copypasta and Duplicate Content policy clarifies what constitutes a violation along with what happens when it is violated.
@MrTLesser @nilsson61307689 @timot78 @igorsushko The only way to get anywhere close will be with low-altitude aircraft/drone optics.

@ImALittleTeaPo9 @TrentTelenko I imagine they can type the coordinates manually into their system. Maybe adds 15 seconds of extra latency? Creating an automated system link, using modern microcontrollers (that can fit _inside_ of an interface cable) could be prototyped in a day or two.
@NoahFiliation @JuliaDavisNews At some point, even some of the elites must realize that some of their sons and grandsons may not be able to escape a mass mobilization.

@nicholrr @TrentTelenko DD-459 was sunk at Guadalcanal. DD-724 was built two years later, and was also a former USS Laffey. DD-724 is the museum ship in SC next to the former USS Yorktown*. (That is CV-10, which itself was a replacement for an earlier â€˜Yorktownâ€™, CV-5, that sank at Midway).
@YourMom4America @MrKat295 @clhubes Hereâ€™s just one example of how _any_ time-based restrictions can be extremely harmful: https://t.co/auWYlX44Om

@lithohedron @boondaburrah @errantambition @Foone Theyâ€™re still used by expensive lab hardware such as oscilloscopes, and also in some military equipment. If you need to quickly move a 50kB file between two air-gapped systems from different vendors, these can be faster, more secure,& lower-overhead than using a USB flash drive.
